name: Channel condition
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Stable, not heavily dredged/incised, allowing normal overbank flows/meanders unless dredging is historical.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Identify incision, dredging, levees, and spoil banks from imagery and confirm in the field or with historical sources where feasible.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Recently dredged trapezoidal channel with levees along both banks.
Criteria: Deeply dredged or fully channelized. No functional floodplain.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Reach is incised by about 1-2 m with continuous spoil banks on one or both banks.
Criteria: Heavily modified or incised with limited floodplain access.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Short straightened segment and intermittent spoil berm on one bank.
Criteria: Slight channelization or partial dredging.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: No levees or spoil banks. Sinuous planform. No signs of dredging.
Criteria: Stable channel. Not incised or dredged. Frequent floodplain access.

references: National Levee Database (NLD) and FEMA floodplain layers (where available).
